model_answer:
The correct order of events is option A: 2 -> 4 -> 1 -> 5 -> 6 -> 3.
First, the title slide appears (option 2), introducing the speaker and the topic. Then, app permissions are modified (option 4), which enables direct messaging. After that, the speaker explains how the create button works (option 1). Next, example tweets are displayed (option 3), and a suggestion appears (option 5).
Finally, the speaker configures the first bot to favorite green energy tweets (option 6) and sets up an out-of-office bot (option 7).

The correct order of events is B: 2 -> 1 -> 3 -> 5 -> 4 -> 6
- In (2), the speaker describes the capabilities of bots and mentions that developers need to agree to terms before creating an app.
- In (1), the speaker reminds listeners to include "http" when creating the application and to agree to the developer terms.
- In (3), the speaker sets the app permissions to allow reading, writing, and direct messaging.
- In (4), the speaker demonstrates how to configure a bot to send direct messages to new followers of a user.
- In (5), the speaker explains that the bot will add tweets containing the hashtag "#lifehack" to a pre-existing list.
- Finally, in (6), the speaker shows how to schedule a bot to run only during specific hours.
